TopicTitle: [1.12.5] Bluedog Design Bureau - Stockalike Saturn, Apollo, and more! (v1.13.0 "Забытый" 13/Aug/2023)

Articles.Content:
3 hours ago, Rory Yammomoto said:

I got some images from the Smithsonian for your reference... 

Dope! So if y'all missed the stream, I took care of some modeling stuff for SEP, and got the Sarnus-1 fairing bases (both 2.5m and 3.125m) in game, as well as the new 1.875m inline probe core module. See if you can spot it!
How do I find out what textures a part uses? For instance the "bluedog_Sargent_3xDecoupler". The folder it's in only contains 2 textures and they're for probes.

10 hours ago, CobaltWolf said:

I don't know if that one actually has Cryogenic Engines configs ready yet. Then again, if you're using the RL-10 with an extending nozzle you're on a dev build and I don't want no complaints

EDIT: Still getting settled in but the stream is up.

https://www.twitch.tv/cobaltwolfy

omg, how is this possible? i MISSED the stream i mustve been asleep or something.

19 hours ago, CobaltWolf said:

I don't know if that one actually has Cryogenic Engines configs ready yet. Then again, if you're using the RL-10 with an extending nozzle you're on a dev build and I don't want no complaints

EDIT: Still getting settled in but the stream is up.

https://www.twitch.tv/cobaltwolfy

the single chambered LR-87 has a config. it is perfect for what I wanted, and it actually has a niche- being an early cryogenic engine..

Edited July 1, 2016 by Rory Yammomoto

23 minutes ago, Rory Yammomoto said:

the single chambered LR-87 has a config. it is perfect for what I wanted, and it actually has a niche- being an early cryogenic engine..

It's also the only cryogenic lifter engine in BDB IIRC. It might be more powerful than the Volcano or whatever the 1.25m Cryogenic Engines lifter engine is.

The US doesn't have a huge variety of cryogenic engines. Besides the RL10 and its variants, there's basically just the J2, the RS68 (which I'm not doing), the SSME (same), and the LR-87-LH... and the STME, which may or may not happen depending on how much @TimothyC bugs me for it after Saturn is in a good place.

EDIT: Forgot to reply to these:

9 hours ago, Nnimrod said:

How do I find out what textures a part uses? For instance the "bluedog_Sargent_3xDecoupler". The folder it's in only contains 2 textures and they're for probes.

They were crammed into the bluedog_JunoProbes texture sheet. Are you trying to prune them? There isn't really an easy way other than asking what specific parts you want to delete - but most parts in a folder share textures, so you can't just delete them willy nilly. Deleting entire folders is fine though.

8 hours ago, 123nick said:

omg, how is this possible? i MISSED the stream i mustve been asleep or something.

You were on Steam and I messaged you lol.

Any suggestions?

10 hours ago, CobaltWolf said:

Can you try manually installing it on a clean copy of KSP? That way we know where to start looking.

Huh... THe only working antennas are the stock ones... I don't think you have any blame in this. Lemme check with another mod pack first.
@Rory Yammomoto ohh I got this bug couple of days ago and I thought immediately that I installed BDB wrong so I just reinstalled and it fixed itself

15 hours ago, NeoFatalis said:

@Rory Yammomoto ohh I got this bug couple of days ago and I thought immediately that I installed BDB wrong so I just reinstalled and it fixed itself

it's an issue with the fact that the dev builds use TGAs instead of DDS. Sometimes TGAs fail to load. I compress them to DDS before release. Since the Saturn isn't released yet...

EDIT: Speaking of which, it occurred to me that you have make the Saturn 1 with the 4x UA1207 solids for the first stage, by Tweakscaling up one of the stock 2.5m > 1.25m adapters by 50%. SOMEONE TRY IT!

Edited July 2, 2016 by CobaltWolf
Spent the morning taking care of a bunch of different things. Not much I can show (yet) but here's a WIP of the textured MOS Airlock.

I just re-installed this pack. And I love it! It is insanely huge, but after looking through the manual and making some subassemblies, it is really amazing.

I have just one request, would it be possible to give the parts their real life counterpart tags like tantares does? I think it would be really nice if I were to search for Atlas, I would get all the Muo parts for example.
